trans-unit.source: Build your first pipeline using Azure Data Factory
trans-unit.target: Build your first pipeline using Azure Data Factory

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to create a sample data pipeline that transforms data using Azure HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to create a sample data pipeline that transforms data using Azure HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Build your first pipeline using Azure Data Factory
trans-unit.target: Build your first pipeline using Azure Data Factory

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.SELECTOR]
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.SELECTOR]

trans-unit.source: Tutorial Overview
trans-unit.target: Tutorial Overview

trans-unit.source: Using Data Factory Editor
trans-unit.target: Using Data Factory Editor

trans-unit.source: Using PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Using PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Using Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Using Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: This article helps you get started with building your first pipeline, and deploy it to the Azure Data Factory.
trans-unit.target: This article helps you get started with building your first pipeline, and deploy it to the Azure Data Factory.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This article does not provide a conceptual overview of the Azure Data Factory service.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This article does not provide a conceptual overview of the Azure Data Factory service.

trans-unit.source: For a detailed overview of the service, see the [Introduction to Azure Data Factory](data-factory-introduction.md) article.
trans-unit.target: For a detailed overview of the service, see the [Introduction to Azure Data Factory](data-factory-introduction.md) article.

trans-unit.source: Tutorial Overview
trans-unit.target: Tutorial Overview

trans-unit.source: This tutorial takes you through the steps needed to get your first pipeline up and running.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial takes you through the steps needed to get your first pipeline up and running.

trans-unit.source: You will be creating pipelines, and specifying all the resources needed from scratch.
trans-unit.target: You will be creating pipelines, and specifying all the resources needed from scratch.

trans-unit.source: If you want to explore the various capabilities of the data factory quickly, without creating one from scratch, you can use the samples that we provide in the Azure Preview Portal.
trans-unit.target: If you want to explore the various capabilities of the data factory quickly, without creating one from scratch, you can use the samples that we provide in the Azure Preview Portal.

trans-unit.source: See [Azure Data Factory Update: Simplified sample deployment](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2015/04/24/azure-data-factory-update-simplified-sample-deployment/) on how to deploy an use-case based sample using the Azure Preview Portal.
trans-unit.target: See [Azure Data Factory Update: Simplified sample deployment](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2015/04/24/azure-data-factory-update-simplified-sample-deployment/) on how to deploy an use-case based sample using the Azure Preview Portal.

trans-unit.source: Pre-requisites
trans-unit.target: Pre-requisites

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have the following pre-requisites:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have the following pre-requisites:

trans-unit.source: **Azure subscription** - If you don't have an Azure subscription, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: **Azure subscription** - If you don't have an Azure subscription, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: See the [Free Trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/) article on how you can obtain a free trial account.
trans-unit.target: See the [Free Trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/) article on how you can obtain a free trial account.

trans-unit.source: **Azure Storage** – You will use an Azure storage account for storing the data in this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: **Azure Storage** – You will use an Azure storage account for storing the data in this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an Azure storage account, see the [Create a storage account](../storage-create-storage-account/#create-a-storage-account) article.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an Azure storage account, see the [Create a storage account](../storage-create-storage-account/#create-a-storage-account) article.

trans-unit.source: After you have created the storage account, you will need to obtain the account key used to access the storage.
trans-unit.target: After you have created the storage account, you will need to obtain the account key used to access the storage.

trans-unit.source: See [View, copy and regenerate storage access keys](../storage-create-storage-account/#view-copy-and-regenerate-storage-access-keys).
trans-unit.target: See [View, copy and regenerate storage access keys](../storage-create-storage-account/#view-copy-and-regenerate-storage-access-keys).

trans-unit.source: What’s covered in this tutorial?
trans-unit.target: What’s covered in this tutorial?

trans-unit.source: Azure Data Factory enables you to compose data movement and data processing tasks as a data driven workflow.
trans-unit.target: Azure Data Factory enables you to compose data movement and data processing tasks as a data driven workflow.

trans-unit.source: You will learn how to build your first pipeline that uses HDInsight to transform and analyze web logs on a monthly basis.
trans-unit.target: You will learn how to build your first pipeline that uses HDInsight to transform and analyze web logs on a monthly basis.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will be performing the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will be performing the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Create a data factory.
trans-unit.target: Create a data factory.

trans-unit.source: Create following linked services:
trans-unit.target: Create following linked services:

trans-unit.source: **Azure Storage Account** – The Azure storage account will be used to store files used by the on-demand HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: **Azure Storage Account** – The Azure storage account will be used to store files used by the on-demand HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: **On-Demand HDInsight Cluster** – A HDInsight cluster will be started on-demand to transform and analyze the data.
trans-unit.target: **On-Demand HDInsight Cluster** – A HDInsight cluster will be started on-demand to transform and analyze the data.

trans-unit.source: Create the output dataset
trans-unit.target: Create the output dataset

trans-unit.source: Create the pipeline that runs a Hive script, and stores the result in the output dataset.
trans-unit.target: Create the pipeline that runs a Hive script, and stores the result in the output dataset.

trans-unit.source: The Hive script first creates an external table, referencing the raw web log data stored in Azure blob storage.
trans-unit.target: The Hive script first creates an external table, referencing the raw web log data stored in Azure blob storage.

trans-unit.source: The next step in the Hive script then partitions the raw data by year and month.
trans-unit.target: The next step in the Hive script then partitions the raw data by year and month.

trans-unit.source: Your first pipeline, called **MyFirstPipeline**, uses a Hive activity to transform and analyze web logs that are deployed as part of the HDInsight cluster, and stored in **/HdiSamples/WebsiteLogSampleData/SampleLog/**.
trans-unit.target: Your first pipeline, called **MyFirstPipeline**, uses a Hive activity to transform and analyze web logs that are deployed as part of the HDInsight cluster, and stored in **/HdiSamples/WebsiteLogSampleData/SampleLog/**.

trans-unit.source: Diagram View
trans-unit.target: Diagram View

trans-unit.source: After the Hive script executes, the results will be stored in an Azure blob storage container: **data/partitioneddata**.
trans-unit.target: After the Hive script executes, the results will be stored in an Azure blob storage container: **data/partitioneddata**.

trans-unit.source: The availability defined on the **AzureBlobOutput** dataset determines how often the Hive activity is run.
trans-unit.target: The availability defined on the **AzureBlobOutput** dataset determines how often the Hive activity is run.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, this is set to monthly.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, this is set to monthly.

trans-unit.source: Prepare Azure Storage for the tutorial
trans-unit.target: Prepare Azure Storage for the tutorial

trans-unit.source: Before starting the tutorial, you need to prepare the Azure storage with files needed for the tutorial.
trans-unit.target: Before starting the tutorial, you need to prepare the Azure storage with files needed for the tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Launch notepad, paste the following text, and save it as **partitionweblogs.hql** in the C:\adfgettingstarted folder on your hard drive.
trans-unit.target: Launch notepad, paste the following text, and save it as **partitionweblogs.hql** in the C:\adfgettingstarted folder on your hard drive.

trans-unit.source: This Hive scripts creates two external tables: **WebLogsRaw** and **WebLogsPartitioned**.
trans-unit.target: This Hive scripts creates two external tables: **WebLogsRaw** and **WebLogsPartitioned**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Replace **storageaccountname** in the last line with the name of your storage account.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Replace **storageaccountname** in the last line with the name of your storage account.

trans-unit.source: To prepare the Azure storage for the tutorial:
trans-unit.target: To prepare the Azure storage for the tutorial:

trans-unit.source: Download the [latest version of **AzCopy**](http://aka.ms/downloadazcopy), or the [latest preview version](http://aka.ms/downloadazcopypr).
trans-unit.target: Download the [latest version of **AzCopy**](http://aka.ms/downloadazcopy), or the [latest preview version](http://aka.ms/downloadazcopypr).

trans-unit.source: See [How to use AzCopy](../storage/storage-use-azcopy.md) article for instructions on using the utility.
trans-unit.target: See [How to use AzCopy](../storage/storage-use-azcopy.md) article for instructions on using the utility.

trans-unit.source: After AzCopy has been installed, you can add it to the system path by running the following command at a command prompt.
trans-unit.target: After AzCopy has been installed, you can add it to the system path by running the following command at a command prompt.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the c:\adfgettingstarted folder, and run the following command to upload the Hive .HQL file to the storage account.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the c:\adfgettingstarted folder, and run the following command to upload the Hive .HQL file to the storage account.

trans-unit.source: Replace **<StorageAccountName\>** with the name of your storage account, and **<Storage Key\>** with the storage account key.
trans-unit.target: Replace **<StorageAccountName\>** with the name of your storage account, and **<Storage Key\>** with the storage account key.

trans-unit.source: After the file has been successfully uploaded, you will see the following output from AzCopy.
trans-unit.target: After the file has been successfully uploaded, you will see the following output from AzCopy.

trans-unit.source: Do the following:
trans-unit.target: Do the following:

trans-unit.source: Click [Using Data Factory Editor](data-factory-build-your-first-pipeline-using-editor.md) link at the top to perform the tutorial by using Data Factory Editor, which is part of the Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: Click [Using Data Factory Editor](data-factory-build-your-first-pipeline-using-editor.md) link at the top to perform the tutorial by using Data Factory Editor, which is part of the Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: Click [Using PowerShell](data-factory-build-your-first-pipeline-using-powershell.md) link at the top to perform the tutorial by using Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Click [Using PowerShell](data-factory-build-your-first-pipeline-using-powershell.md) link at the top to perform the tutorial by using Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Click [Using Visual Studio](data-factory-build-your-first-pipeline-using-vs.md) link at the top to perform the tutorial by using Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Click [Using Visual Studio](data-factory-build-your-first-pipeline-using-vs.md) link at the top to perform the tutorial by using Visual Studio.
